column1: | Most infractions punished as a ''[[balk]]''. In United States high school baseball the ball is automatically dead and all runners advance one base. At the college and professional levels the ball is not automatically dead. If the batter hits a balk pitch and all runners advance at least one base the balk is ignored otherwise the balk is enforced.
column2: | The ball remains live. If the batter reaches base successfully and all runners advance no penalty; otherwise the play is negated the pitch attempt is automatically a ball and runners advance one base.
column3: | The ball remains live. If the batter does not swing the pitch is automatically a ball.
